title: Valuetype
text: Hello,In Crystal Reports 8 and 11 we have the following command,crxReport.ParameterFields.Item(i) .ValueTypeThis command then returned with a number eg. 7, 9,10,12 etc.Which command must i use to make this happen or am I doing it wrong.Thanks.
author: Ludi Kuyper
Ludi Kuyper
text: The problem is solved with .Parameterfields.item(i).ValueType I must use another field .Parameterfields.item(i).ParameterValueType.tostringThank you
title: Re:Valuetype

title: let me pls explane about export and import parameters ?
text: let me pls explain about export and import parameters,i have lot of confusion understanding this two? -THANK YOU
author: Vidya Bodapati
Bhushan Ghule
text: Hi Vidya .Import/Export parameters are used in subroutines , function module ,Class-methods ...etc suppose you are using Import/export parameters with function module then Import parameter will accept the value from main program and after processing it will generate export value which can be used in your main program.Hope its clear .Thanks & regards .Bhushan
title: Re:let me pls explane about export and import parameters ?

author: Naveen Kumar
text: Hi Vidya,This is not the Exact thread where you need to Post ,You are asking about which Module?Export:After reports got developed from Development team,User need to see the data then we will do export.Import:Before Development ,we need to Import data and Design as per the requirement of the customer .RegardsNK

title: How to set up my own test SAP FI/CO environment?
text: My request contains if it is possible to acquire a test/ demo environment in SAP for the SAP FI/ CO modules (important to notice that i am looking for a complete implemented environment where for example some masterdata already is deployed (company codes, cost centers etc). Where it is also possible to book journal postings in the tables, run transactions to retrieve data from the tables, autorisation to look into the tables and display the data (SE16). But also make it possible to extract the data in the tables to a BI tool (Qlikview, Tableau etc.) and make it possible to set up Test reports. Who could help me with a step by step guidance? My background is not technical but functional business. Thank you in advance for reading this.
author: Joost van der Poel
Jeroen Custers
text: Hi Joost,I don't know if your question is still applicable, but this is not the right place to ask this question. I think you are looking for a IDES system. See this link for more information about IDES: http://service.sap.com/ides Best regards,Jeroen
title: Re:How to set up my own test SAP FI/CO environment?

author: Joost van der Poel
text: Hi Jeroen,De link naar de IDES pagina vereist extra inlog gegevens. Heb je deze informatie wellicht ook op een andere manier tot je beschikking. Groeten Joost
title: Re:How to set up my own test SAP FI/CO environment?

author: Jeroen Custers
text: Hi Joost,You need to be a SAP customer of partner to access that site. You can then log in with the so-called S-user. Maybe this link is a better option for you: consolut - Get access to consolut international ag's IDES system Best regards,Jeroen
title: Re:How to set up my own test SAP FI/CO environment?

title: Unable to persist relationship between two entities
text: I am building a small app using JPA, Olingo and SAPUI5 on the HANA Cloud Platform to familiarize myself with the HANA Cloud Platform. The app has two entities: a "lesson" and a "vocable". A lesson can have multiple vocables. The problem that I face is that I am somehow not able to persist the relationship between the two.Using my coding I am able to create vocables and I am able to create lessons. I even get a success message when I first create a lesson and then create a vocable by posting to /vocab-web/vocab.svc/Lessons(1L)/VocableDetails. Both the lesson as well as the vocable are persisted at the database but the relationship between the two is lost. I tried various things all without success.I am desperately looking for any hints and ideas on how to fix this.I attached the two JPA classes (renamed to .txt) and the generated $metadata file.This is the code that I use to create the vocable that is linked to a lesson that I previously created:addNewVocable : function(sLearned, sKnown, oTable) { var vocables = {}; var resource = window.location.protocol + "//"  + window.location.hostname + (window.location.port ? ":" + window.location.port : "") + "/vocab-web/vocab.svc/Lessons(" + "1L" + ")"; vocables.Learned = sLearned; vocables.Known = sKnown; vocables.Level = 1; vocables.DueDate = new Date().toISOString().replace("Z", "0000"); this.getView().getModel().create("/Lessons(1L)/VocableDetails", vocables, null, this.successMsg, this.errorMsg); },If you want to have a look at the complete source code you can have a look at RuedigerMueller/vocab  GitHubAny help is highly appreciated.Thanks, Rdiger
author: Ruediger Mueller
Ruediger Mueller
text: I was able to find a work-around (or is it the solution?). I first create the vocable and then - with an AJAX call - establish the link between the vocable and the lesson (see hard coded solution below).One thing I don't understand: I have to use PUT for the AJAX call. If I use POST if get a 405 Method not allowed. According to the OData documentation POST creates the link and PUT updates the link. If POST does not work and only PUT ist working: does that mean the link does somehow get created but just not the correct one? On the DB the link column is empty... Questions over questions.addNewVocable : function(sLearned, sKnown, oTable) { var vocables = {}; vocables.Learned = sLearned; vocables.Known = sKnown; vocables.Level = 1; vocables.DueDate = new Date().toISOString().replace("Z", "0000"); this.getView().getModel().create("/Vocables", vocables, null, this.successMsg, this.errorMsg);//Establish link with the lesson jQuery.ajax({ url : 'http://localhost:8080/vocab-web/vocab.svc/Vocables(2L)/$links/LessonDetails', type : 'PUT', contentType : 'application/xml', data : '<uri xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/ado/2007/08/dataservices">http://localhost:8080/vocab-web/vocab.svc/Lessons(1L)</uri>' });},
title: Re:Unable to persist relationship between two entities

author: Puja Bhattacharya

title: Integrate SAP and SalesForce without Netweaver
text: Hello SAP Development Community!I am tasked with integrating SAP (Running ECC 5.0) with SalesForce. It's been my understanding that this task should be pretty straightforward by using Netweaver to facilitate the handling of web services between the two platforms.However...I am on the SalesForce side of this equation. On the SAP side, they are not running Netweaver. They perform Remote Function Calls to communicate with external systems.So does anyone in the community have any information on best practices for this? I'm struggling to find any documentation on the web regarding this technique. Everything I can find refers to the use of Netweaver. On the SalesForce side, I cannot find anything concerning the creation of outbound Remote Function Calls; it seems this is something that is native to the C language (SalesForce uses the proprietary Apex language).Any advice is appreciated.- Joe

author: Nick Jack

title: How to develop a SAP Application?
text: Hello,I have some questions.I want to develop a SAP Application/addon and i just want to know what i to look for?Is SAPMini enough for the development of an application?How does the productd evelopment in general work?Is there something special i have to care about?Best wishes,
author: Philipp Hauptmann
Flávio Alves
text: Hello, Philipp.First of all, please be aware that an SAP application is not like an application written, for example, in C++. One of the differences between an SAP program (written in ABAP) and a C++ program is that the later becomes independent from its development environment (in the form of an independent, executable file), while an ABAP application needs the SAP runtime system to be executed."All ABAP programs reside inside the SAP database. They are not stored in separate external files like Java or C++ programs. In the database all ABAP code exists in two forms: source code, which can be viewed and edited with the ABAP Workbench tools; and generated code, a binary representation somewhat comparable with Java bytecode. ABAP programs execute under the control of the runtime system, which is part of the SAP kernel. The runtime system is responsible for processing ABAP statements, controlling the flow logic of screens and responding to events (such as a user clicking on a screen button); in this respect it can be seen as a Virtual Machine comparable with the Java VM." -- Wikipedia/ABAPThat said, let's take a look at your questions:1. I want to develop a SAP Application/addon and i just want to know what i to look for?Please, visit:SAP Developer Center - "On this site we offer you a complete set of resources for developing with SAP technology, platforms and tools. A one-stop development shop just for you."Tutorial: How to install and use the Mini SAP system - this website also has many links to resources on other ABAP programming topics, like Getting Started, ABAP (Basic, Advanced), Development Frameworks, Documentation and Translation, Forms, Basis Components, Communication Interfaces, Business Framework, and Design Guide.2. Is SAPMini enough for the development of an application?It depends on your plans. Like I said, an ABAP program is different from a C++ program. Please, read below:"What is Mini SAP?The easiest way to answer this question is to explain what Mini SAP is not. Any ECC or ERP business components are missing in this package. But all basis components are available, such as ABAP, ABAP Objects, Smart Forms, ALV, Graphics Framework, all other control frameworks, SAPoffice etc.Mini SAP, which is also known as SAP NetWeaver Trial, or SAP NetWeaver Developer Edition, is free for personal use. Licenses must be renewed every three months.So Mini SAP is the ideal tool both for students to get used to the SAP programming environment as well as ABAP developers to use as a sandbox system. If you want to get a sandbox for the ECC components, you'll have to obtain a license for an IDES system from SAP. This would usually be too expensive for personal use. But you can get free IDES remote access from consolut." -- Tutorial: How to install and use the Mini SAP system3. How does the product development in general work?Here's an interesting document on this matter: SAP Custom Development Process.4. Is there something special I have to care about?IF SY-SUBRC NE 0.* This. :-)ENDIF.----Finally, welcome to the SCN!Please, keep participating by posting more questions, comments and also marking other comments as liked, helpful or, when your question have been answered, as correct.Best regards,Flvio.
title: Re:How to develop a SAP Application?

author: Philipp Hauptmann
text: Thank you (-:that was i wanted to know (-:
title: Re:How to develop a SAP Application?

author: Flávio Alves
text: You're welcome, Philipp! Thanks for accepting my answer!Best regards,Flvio.

title: Show a report as a MDI child window
text: Hi I develop with language C++ under Microsoft Visual Studio 2010. I try to open a report using Crystal Reports 2011. To open the Crystal Reports 2011 - report under C++, I wrote a wrapper class (DLL) using C#. It is possible to open and show a report. My problem is that the report is shown in a separate flying window instead in a MDI child window. How do I show a report in an MDI child window ? Do anybody have example code ? Regards Alfred Willi
author: Alfred Willi

title: How to delete huge amount of data from custom database tables?
text: Hi,I have an issue with deletion of huge records from the custom database tables. Requirement is to create a report which will display the data from custom tables based on the selection criteria. For this I am fetching the data from the table and deleting by using the delete statement ( DELETE TABLE TABLENAME FROM INTERNAL TABLE).When we are running the report with huge amount of data( above 1 lakh), delete statement is getting into dump. As we are running this in background, job is getting cancelled because of this delete statement is giving dump. Could you please help me to avoid this dump. And please suggest me how to proceed to delete the huge amount of data from the tables, through the report.Thankyou in advance.
author: Annapoorna Koona

title: Search/Conversion tool for Java-based source
text: Hi, I'm Tamaki, a member of Platform Sales in Japan.One of our biggest target customer had a huge Java-based custom-made system, built in 2011.They're asking questions as below, I understand there is no appropriate SAP solution, but I'd like to get advice if possible from specialists like you.Questions;1. Is there any tool to manage/search their tons of existing JAVA source code like Service Repository ?2. Is there any conversion tool for Java-based UI which is currently working on IE only to multi-browser based UI ?They are thinking that they need to replace current system to new one like SAP ERP near future, so we'd like to support them.I'm not sure this community is suitable for this question or not, but any comment would be appreciated.kind regards,Tamaki SAKAMOTO
author: Tamaki Sakamoto

title: Is there a way to retain instance variables
text: Hi, We are working with UI5 as the front end and ABAP objects being used in the back queries. When UI5 is launched, one RFC FM instantiates the backend class which fetches data from DB and the buffers are stored in the attributes. The data is sent to UI5 (which actually closes the session). After the user updates, when the data has to be updated to the DB, a 2nd RFC FM is called. Is there a way in which the 1st instance can be retrieved so that we can avoid the data fetch once again ?Regards,Raghuveer
author: Raghuveer Ghatikar

title: Quick Launch page in HANA Modeler perspective missing

author: Marcus Schiffer
Virinchy P
text: Hi Marcus ,Are you referring to Quick View in Hana Modeler perspective as in the below screenshot?If so , In the Menu tab navigate to Window --> Show View -->select Quick VIew The above option would be enabled nly in Hana modeler perspective , which can be accessed from Window --> Open perspective --> Hana modelerRegardsVirinchy

text: Hi Virinchi,it is not the Quick View perspective, which I can still see.It is "Quick Launch", from there you seelinks top creating a new package, a new procedure, analytic view etc.This perspective is gone after installing the latest Upgrades from the SAP Luna upgrade site.

title: Re:Quick Launch page in HANA Modeler perspective missing

author: Alexander Silgidjian
text: Hi Marcus,I suppose that you have received HANA Tools SP9 and the Quick Launch got replaced by Quick View:"Easy access to frequently performed tasks (New)A Quick View pane, which is available as soon as you launch your SAP HANA studio, replaces the existing Quick Launch section and allows you to navigate quickly and perform modeling tasks such as Validate, Activate, Schema Mapping, and so on."See more at: http://help.sap.com/hana/Whats_New_SAP_HANA_Platform_Release_Notes_en.pdfKind Regards,Alex
